cards.description: Ideas are created and share here through a card.After creation, you can move your card to the todo list.

cards.title: Backlog
cards.description: A list of the things we think we want to do, maybe not quite ready for work, but high likelihood of being worked on. This is the staging area where specs should get fleshed out. No limit on the list size, but we should reconsider if it gets long.

cards.title: [Example task with designs]
cards.description: Attach designs conveniently using Power-ups for design tools like Figma or Invision

cards.title: To Do
cards.description: This is a list of things that are good to pull off to work on, prioritized.If there are too few items here, we should swarm against getting tasks ready for work.

cards.title: [Example task with designs]
cards.description: Attach designs conveniently using Power-ups for design tools like Figma or Invision

cards.title: Doing
cards.description: These are the things that folks are working on. All our engineers should have at least one item in this state. If there are too few things here, they should be pulled off Todo. When doing is done, cards move to Code Review.

cards.title: Doing
cards.description: These are the things that folks are working on. All our engineers should have at least one item in this state. If there are too few things here, they should be pulled off Todo. When doing is done, cards move to Code Review.

cards.title: Code Review
cards.description: This list is for items in code review. When a task has gotten approval, it moves off to Testing. If there are too many cards here, we should break off from other tasks to get code review done.

cards.title: This list has the List Limits Power-up enabled, to help the team prioritize and remove bottlenecks before picking up new work. The list will be highlighted if the number of cards in it passes the limit that the team determines based on team size.
Preparation
cards.description: This template may be used to run Health Monitors in person or remotely over video conferencing. To use this template: Copy the template Make the new board based on the template private Give the new board a name such as [Team Name] Health Monitor [dd-MMM-YYYY] (Private) Work with the person requesting th Health Monitor to order the attributes (lists) in the order in which they'd like to cover them in case there isn't time to go through all of the attributes Add the people who will participate in the Health Monitor (double-check with the person requesting the Health Monitor whether they would like to include the manager(s) of the team) Archive this list once you are done with preparing the board

cards.title: Post-Meeting
cards.description: After the meeting is over Tally the number of votes on each card and enter them into the # Votes field. Remove members from all cards. Double-checkthat your notes don't link opinions back to individuals. Copy the board Give the new board a name such as [Team Name] Health Monitor [dd-MMM-YYYY]Open the board up to the broader team

cards.title: Tips
cards.description: If the team is new to doing Health Monitors, take some time to explain what a Health Monitor is, why the team is doing one and how it works. Even if the team has done these for years, some reminders are still helpful to hear at the start of a Health Monitor. Here are a few suggestion: Individual names will be scrubbed before making the results of this Health Monitor public. Honesty is key. There are no right or wrong answers. Everyone's opinion is valid. Focus on observations and resist the temptation to solve problems while going through the attributes The purpose of the Health Monitor is to help the team, not to compare teams with one another. A lot of us belong to many different teams, for this exercise, focus on this team, the team doing the Health Monitor, when responding.If the team had follow-up items from a previous Health Monitor, review those first. Run a practice voting round to make sure that everyone understands how to vote by tapping the space bar while hovering over the card that they'd like to vote on. Save at least 10 minutes at the end to ensure that there is time to discuss next steps. Ask clarifying questions. When coming up with next steps, try to identify an owner and agree to a target date for the action items. If you're doing the Health Monitor in person in an office, make sure that you have a suitable space set up (e.g., consider size, privacy, and wi-fi). For more on the Atlassian Health Monitor: https://www.atlassian.com/team-playbook/health-monitor

cards.title: How does this board work?
cards.description: For each of the lists to the right: The facilitator will read each attribute's statements. When the facilitator indicates to do so, the participants will add their avatar to either the green, yellow, or red card for that statement to indicate their vote. For each card with votes, a participant will share why they voted for that color.

Teamwork
cards.description: We are a totally gelled super-team with awesome collaboration! ‚Üî We are a bunch of individuals that neither know nor care about what the other people in the squad are doing.they should be pulled off Todo. When doing is done, cards move to Code Review.

cards.title: We have no idea why we are here, there's no high level picture or focus. Our so called mission is completely unclear and uninspiring.
Shared mission
cards.description: We know exactly why we are here and we're really excited about it! ‚Üî We have no idea why we are here, there's no high level picture or focus. Our so called mission is completely unclear and uninspiring.

cards.title: We deliver hogwash. We feel ashamed to deliver it. Our stakeholders hate us.
Delivering value
cards.description: We deliver great stuff! We're proud of it and our stakeholders are really happy. ‚ÜîWe deliver hogwash. We feel ashamed to deliver it. Our stakeholders hate us.

cards.description: Shipping is simple, safe, painless and mostly automated. Our way of working fits us perfectly! ‚Üî Shipping is risky, painful, lots of manual work and takes forever. Our way of working is miserable!

Velocity/Speed
cards.description: We get stuff done really quickly! No waiting and no delays. ‚Üî We never seem to get anything done. We keep getting stuck or interrupted. Stories keep getting stuck on dependencies.
